page.title: 18Radwell, near Milton Ernest
page.content: {Radwell}lies about 2 miles to the West of{Milton Ernest.}It is a hamlet of Felmersham, a neighbouring village. It has a population of about 100 who live mainly in detached expensive housing. The public house, called The Swan, is in the centre of the hamlet on the main road and dates from the 16th century when originally it was a blacksmith's forge. There is a {Methodist Chapel}which has been converted into a private house. On the road from{Milton Ernest,}just outside the hamlet, is a very narrow stone bridge across the{Great Ouse River which nowadays causes considerable traffic congestion. Approaching this bridge on the{Milton Ernest}side across the flood meadows is a raised footpath one quarter of a mile long. There are two farms, one dairy and one dairy and arable.
